themes.scientific_basis: Based on value alignment theories, highlighting how shared core values impact long-term relationship satisfaction.
themes.description: This theme assesses the alignment of each partner's core values, such as family, career, and lifestyle priorities, to evaluate the foundation of compatibility in their relationship.

themes.scientific_basis: Grounded in research on emotional intelligence and its role in relationships.
themes.description: This theme examines how well couples understand and respond to each other's emotional needs, enhancing empathy and mutual support in the relationship.

themes.scientific_basis: Inspired by conflict resolution research, including Gottman's work on conflict styles and their impact on compatibility.
themes.description: This theme looks at each partner's approach to conflict, identifying compatibility in handling disagreements and promoting constructive resolution.

themes.scientific_basis: Based on the similarity-attraction theory, which shows that shared intellectual interests and stimulation foster compatibility.
themes.description: This theme evaluates intellectual compatibility by exploring each partner's interests, curiosity, and capacity for deep conversation, adding depth to the connection.

themes.scientific_basis: Drawn from compatibility research focusing on lifestyle alignment, including habits and daily routines.
themes.description: This theme assesses lifestyle compatibility by exploring daily routines, social preferences, and future ambitions, helping couples understand how their lifestyles fit together.

themes.scientific_basis: Grounded in relationship research on shared goals and future planning.
themes.description: This theme explores each partner's vision for the future, from family planning to financial goals, assessing how aligned their aspirations are for long-term compatibility.

themes.scientific_basis: Based on personality compatibility studies, including introversion-extroversion research.
themes.description: This theme looks at the balance of social energy between partners, examining how their introversion or extroversion levels align and influence their social and alone time preferences.

themes.scientific_basis: Grounded in sexual health and compatibility research, emphasizing the role of aligned sexual needs.
themes.description: This theme addresses compatibility in sexual needs and preferences, exploring how each partner's desires contribute to mutual satisfaction in the intimate aspects of their relationship.

themes.scientific_basis: Inspired by research on decision-making and its role in relationship compatibility.
themes.description: This theme explores each partner's approach to making decisions, assessing whether they prefer structured planning, spontaneity, or compromise, which affects daily and long-term choices.

themes.scientific_basis: Based on Gary Chapman's five love languages and related research on love expression and compatibility.
themes.description: This theme examines how each partner prefers to give and receive love, revealing compatibility in love languages and how well they meet each other's emotional needs.
